Material used.Description: Transgenic Drosophila over-expressing human LRRK2 alleles (wild type, G2019S, Y1699C, and G2385R) were used for immunohistochemical analysis of whole-mount adult fly brains.

Readout description.Result Description: Significant degeneration of dopaminergic (DA) neurons in PPM clusters 1 and 3 in aged flies (60 days old) expressing G2019S LRRK2 compared to controls.
Significant degeneration of dopaminergic (DA) neurons in PPM clusters 1 and 3 in aged flies (60 days old) expressing Y1699C LRRK2 compared to controls.
Age-dependent degeneration of dopaminergic (DA) neurons in PPM clusters 1 and 3 in aged flies (60 days old) expressing G2385R LRRK2, similar to G2019S.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple flies (n=10) were analyzed for DA neuron counts in different clusters.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2-expressing flies were used as a control.

Basic negative control.Description: Age-matched normal flies were used as controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No significant loss of DA neurons compared to age-matched controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant loss of DA neurons in specific clusters compared to age-matched controls.

Material used.Description: Three groups of 20 female adult flies expressing LRRK2 transgenes under the Ddc-GAL4 driver were used for climbing assays.

Readout description.Result Description: Aged flies (60 days old) expressing G2019S LRRK2 recorded dramatically poorer climbing scores (<10% success) compared to controls.
Aged flies (60 days old) expressing Y1699C LRRK2 recorded dramatically poorer climbing scores (<10% success) compared to controls.
Aged flies (60 days old) expressing G2385R LRRK2 did not show significantly compromised climbing ability compared to controls.

Biological replicates.Description: Three groups of 20 flies were tested in each experiment.

Technical replicates.Description: Three trials were performed in each experiment at 15 min intervals.

Basic positive control.Description: Age-matched normal flies were used as controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Results are presented as mean ± SEM of the scores obtained in three independent experiments.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Climbing success rate comparable to control flies.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Climbing success rate significantly lower than control flies (<10% success).

Material used.Description: Flies were fed with cornmeal-agar medium containing 50 µM rotenone immediately after eclosion and during the entire experimental period.

Readout description.Result Description: Accelerated loss of DA neurons in PPM 2/3 clusters in rotenone-treated flies expressing G2019S LRRK2 beyond that in controls or untreated flies.
Rotenone treatment did not aggravate the phenotype of Y1699C LRRK2-expressing flies at the end of the 15-day experimental period.
Accelerated loss of DA neurons in PPM 2/3 and PAL clusters in rotenone-treated flies expressing G2385R LRRK2 beyond that in controls or untreated flies.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple flies (n=15) were analyzed for DA neuron counts after rotenone treatment.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2-expressing flies were used as a control.

Basic negative control.Description: Control flies treated with vehicle (DMSO) alone were used.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No enhanced DA neurodegeneration compared to control flies.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Accelerated DA neurodegeneration compared to control flies or untreated flies.
